parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To witness, bear witness, give evidence, testify, give a good report. From martus; to be a witness, i.e. Testify.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

word: to send them on their way
parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To send forward, accompany, equip for a journey. From pro and pempo; to send forward, i.e. Escort or aid in travel.
Worthily, in a manner worthy of. Adverb from axios; appropriately.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
